items.title: Hormone replacement therapy can slow decline in lung function for middle-aged women
items.summary: Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) can slow the decline in lung function in middle-aged women, according to new research.

alternate.title: Hormone replacement therapy can slow decline in lung function for middle-aged women

items.title: Converting waste toilet paper into electricity
items.summary: Chemists have performed a techno-economic analysis of converting waste toilet paper into electricity. They propose a two-step process and calculate a cost per kWh comparable to that of residential photovoltaic installations.

alternate.title: Converting waste toilet paper into electricity

thumbnail.title: Converting waste toilet paper into electricity

items.title: A drone for last-centimeter delivery
items.summary: A new drone uses cutting-edge technology to deliver parcels weighing up to 500 grams. The device will never get stuck in traffic, itâ€™s programmed to avoid obstacles, and it can reach destinations on steep or uneven terrain. Its protective cage and foldable design mean that it can be carried around in a backpack and used in total safety.

items.title: Light on exoplanets may be quite different from Earth: Different photosynthesis?
items.summary: Researchers have proposed a prediction that red-edge could be observed as on the Earth even on exoplanets around M-dwarfs. They pointed out that the first oxgenic photorophs are most likely to have evolved underwater to utilize visible light just like what had happened in the primordial ocean on the Earth. They examined light adaptation mechanisms of visible- and IR-radiation-using phototrophs required for adapting to land habitats and found out that IR-using phototrophs struggle to adapt to changing light condition at the boundary of water and land surface.

alternate.title: Light on exoplanets may be quite different from Earth: Different photosynthesis?

thumbnail.title: Light on exoplanets may be quite different from Earth: Different photosynthesis?
